availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Remy (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Williams Remy on May 4, 1846. Father of Charles G. Remy, George W. Remy, Thursey Remy, Mary A. Remy, Acy I Remy, Ludana K. Remy, Lurana F. Remy, and Nancy M. Remy. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850 and 1860. Sergeant in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 105A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 108.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Flat Gap, p. 29.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001912950, p. 204.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 897.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Jefferson Ramey, Sr (1825-1902)," Memorial #123689244, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/123689244# (accessed October 16, 2018).
